result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan R. Pehlke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Enroll in, pay, and complete SAFE program.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
4 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan R. Pehlke

Ct. 2 Strangulation and suffocation >> D&RI
16CF30:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CF1105:
Ct. 1 Child abuse- intentionally cause harm >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Enroll, complete, and pay for SAFE program. No restitution requested. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. No contact with victim- M.B.B. If revoked on this charge, 4 days credit granted. Cash bond posted in 15CF1105 of $500 be returned to poster - Scott Pehlke.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
